Explanation_11:
You  wrote review  review text: "I got the Energy Micro 5.1 for my living room to balance my desire for better sound with my wife not wanting obtrusive audio gear cluttering the room. I am only using the front 3 speakers and sub woofer as my surrounds are in-ceiling. What can I say... audio clarity is excellent and having a separate center really helps with separating dialog from other sound effects. The speakers can put out a surprisingly high volume before experiencing any distortion and are complemented well by the small sub. As a bonus, they also look very good and sit nicely mounted on the wall, barely extending beyond my low-profile mounted LCD. I've mounted them using the VideoSecu MS40B4 WN3 (the ones with the 1/4" 20 thread) and they fit perfectly. Your satisfaction will probably depend somewhat on the room they are installed in but a little common sense is needed. These will sound weak in a 20'x20' greatroom but for a modest living room or TV area they are perfect." for item "Energy RC-Micro 5.1 Surround Speaker System (Black)" (with categories "Electronics"),

which is similar to  review text: "I own a 37 inch jvc, and honestly the i was fine with the built in speakers that it had. the sound quality was good enough for me not to complain about. but i just decided to be a little fancy and go for a sound bar. spent hours trying to find a sound bar that would be good and fit my budget. then i saw this, read most of the reviews and decided to get it. well im glad i did, it is a good 95$ spent! these speakers blow my tv speakers out of the water, my t.v is in my room. my room is big enough to fit about 4 queen sized beds. its kinda small but not too small, but this speakers are ideal for a room such as this. these speakers make the room sound like a theater. the subwoofer is a nice touch and bass is just awesome. honestly i would like to give it a 4.5 if i could but i couldnt. i bought a 50$ blu ray dvd player due to my budget. the speakers arent compatible with every player, unless you spend extra $$ on different wires and cables, or on a main receiver ( which i didint have the money for ) so i had to spend a little more on a better blu ray player that was about 100$ that had more options and outputs and input. so that it would be able to play through the speakers. however, if your not on a budget, or you already have a receiver and everything you need or dont care about $$. honestly these speakers are awesome, i see no reason to spend 200 300 400 $ or more on sound systems unless your t.v is in a large room." for item "Philips Bluetooth Soundbar Speaker with Subwoofer Black" (with categories "Electronics"),

which is the review of  "Philips Bluetooth Soundbar Speaker with Subwoofer Black" (with categories "Electronics")

Explanation_11:
You  wrote review  review text: "I got the Energy Micro 5.1 for my living room to balance my desire for better sound with my wife not wanting obtrusive audio gear cluttering the room. I am only using the front 3 speakers and sub woofer as my surrounds are in-ceiling. What can I say... audio clarity is excellent and having a separate center really helps with separating dialog from other sound effects. The speakers can put out a surprisingly high volume before experiencing any distortion and are complemented well by the small sub. As a bonus, they also look very good and sit nicely mounted on the wall, barely extending beyond my low-profile mounted LCD. I've mounted them using the VideoSecu MS40B4 WN3 (the ones with the 1/4" 20 thread) and they fit perfectly. Your satisfaction will probably depend somewhat on the room they are installed in but a little common sense is needed. These will sound weak in a 20'x20' greatroom but for a modest living room or TV area they are perfect." for item "Energy RC-Micro 5.1 Surround Speaker System (Black)" (with categories "Electronics"),

which is similar to  review text: "I own a 37 inch jvc, and honestly the i was fine with the built in speakers that it had. the sound quality was good enough for me not to complain about. but i just decided to be a little fancy and go for a sound bar. spent hours trying to find a sound bar that would be good and fit my budget. then i saw this, read most of the reviews and decided to get it. well im glad i did, it is a good 95$ spent! these speakers blow my tv speakers out of the water, my t.v is in my room. my room is big enough to fit about 4 queen sized beds. its kinda small but not too small, but this speakers are ideal for a room such as this. these speakers make the room sound like a theater. the subwoofer is a nice touch and bass is just awesome. honestly i would like to give it a 4.5 if i could but i couldnt. i bought a 50$ blu ray dvd player due to my budget. the speakers arent compatible with every player, unless you spend extra $$ on different wires and cables, or on a main receiver ( which i didint have the money for ) so i had to spend a little more on a better blu ray player that was about 100$ that had more options and outputs and input. so that it would be able to play through the speakers. however, if your not on a budget, or you already have a receiver and everything you need or dont care about $$. honestly these speakers are awesome, i see no reason to spend 200 300 400 $ or more on sound systems unless your t.v is in a large room." for item "Philips Bluetooth Soundbar Speaker with Subwoofer Black" (with categories "Electronics"),

which is the review of  "Philips Bluetooth Soundbar Speaker with Subwoofer Black" (with categories "Electronics")
